item.title: Strongest Pokemon That Rely On Only One Move
item.description:
There are several Pokemon that have made a name for themselves in the competitive scene due to different attributes, like their type combinations, abilities, stats, etc. However, some of them are infamous for only being proficient in battle because there’s a single effective move they can learn, and not much more.

Needless to say, numerous Pokemon are flat-out infamous for relying way too much on one move , to the point that they have completely lost their battle viability when that move was removed and/or nerfed in subsequent generations. This has occurred many times throughout the Pokemon franchise, but the following creatures are the most notorious examples of this strange but fascinating phenomenon.

Ditto

Relies On Transform

  • Type : Normal
  • Category : Status
  • Power : -
  • Debut : Generation One
  • Effect : Allows its user to copy the target and its move set.

There’s no other Pokemon more famous for relying on a single move than Ditto , the Transform Pokemon from Generation One. As implied by its Pokemon Category, it can literally only learn and use Transform , which allows it to copy the opponent’s appearance and move set.

This is a very fun gimmick that has helped Ditto stand out for almost thirty years, but it’s also extremely risky. If it’s knocked out too quickly or if Transform is deactivated in some way before it can use it, there’s nothing else Ditto can do in combat. Fortunately, this was somewhat fixed when the hidden ability Imposter was added in Generation Five, which allows Ditto to transform into its opponent the very moment it lands on the battlefield.

Breloom

Relies On Spore

  • Type : Grass
  • Category : Status
  • Power : -
  • Debut : Generation One
  • Effect : The user scatters spores that put opponents to sleep.

Every Pokemon that’s based on a mushroom can learn Spore , an extremely effective status move that can induce sleep with no real drawbacks. However, most of them—like Amoonguss or Toedscruel—are durable supporters that can do other things aside from putting their opponents to sleep, whereas Breloom would be nothing without this move.

The strategy to effectively use Breloom in battle is quite simple: it puts its target to sleep with Spore and keeps attacking them with its physical Grass and Fighting-type attacks until they faint. Rinse and repeat. Truth be told, there’s not much more Breloom can do if Spore is deactivated (or it runs out of PP), as its low Speed stat and double weakness to Flying-type attacks make it extremely vulnerable when it loses that huge advantage.

Rayquaza

Relies On Dragon Ascent

  • Type : Flying
  • Category : Physical
  • Power : 120
  • Debut : Generation Six
  • Effect : Attacks the target and lowers the user’s Defense and Special Defense.

Rayquaza has always been an extremely powerful legendary Pokemon with a large variety of strong physical and special attacks to choose from. Even so, everything changed when its brand-new signature move, Dragon Ascent , was introduced in Pokemon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire .

This is not only a really powerful physical attack with a only a minor drawback (seeing as Rayquaza is not really a defensive Pokemon), but it also allows Rayquaza to Mega Evolve. Nowadays, it’s almost impossible to find a Rayquaza that doesn’t know Dragon Ascent (even in games without Mega Evolution), so its very existence makes it really easy for competitive players to predict which moves their opponent’s Rayquaza is going to use.

Darkrai

Relies On Dark Void

  • Type : Dark
  • Category : Status
  • Power : -
  • Debut : Generation Four
  • Effect : Puts all the opposing Pokemon to sleep.

Sleep-inducing attacks without any drawbacks (like low accuracy) are very hard to come by, which is why Darkrai made such a big impact on the competitive Pokemon scene after its debut. Keeping in line with its nightmare theme, its signature move, Dark Void , allows it to put all the Pokemon on the opposite side of the battlefield to sleep at the same time.

With 80% accuracy, this was a really effective and useful move, especially in Double or Triple battles. Unfortunately, Dark Void was severely nerfed in subsequent generations, and its accuracy was brought down to 50%, making it even less reliable than Hypnosis. This completely destroyed Darkrai’s competitive viability and, ironically enough, this nerf was most likely put into effect because of a separate Pokemon: Smeargle, who often used Dark Void via its own signature move, Sketch.

Xerneas

Relies On Geomancy

  • Type : Fairy
  • Category : Status
  • Power : -
  • Debut : Generation Six
  • Effect : It sharply boosts the user’s Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed after waiting for one turn.

Xerneas is infamous for being one of the most overpowered Pokemon in the entire franchise, mainly thanks to its excellent signature move, Geomancy . Waiting for one whole turn in exchange for boosting three different stats by two stages seems like a reasonable compromise at first, but this simple drawback can be completely eliminated by equipping this Pokemon with a Power Herb.

Successfully activating Geomancy makes Xerneas into an extremely powerful special attacker, and almost every single trainer who has trained and used one in battle chooses to keep its signature move. Nevertheless, this is a similar situation to Rayquaza. Xerneas is a powerful Legendary Pokemon that can learn many other solid moves, yet the existence of Geomancy has made it very predictable in the competitive scene.

Rillaboom

Relies On Grassy Glide

  • Type : Grass
  • Category : Physical
  • Power : 70 (55 in Generation Nine)
  • Debut : Generation Eight
  • Effect : It always goes first on Grassy Terrain.

For a while, it seemed like Rillaboom was going to get the short end of the stick in terms of competitive viability when compared to its fellow Kalos Starter Pokemon, Cinderance and Inteleon. However, the complete opposite ended up happening, as it was eventually given the excellent combination of Grassy Surge and Grassy Glide .

Grassy Glide is a physical move that always goes first when there’s Grassy Terrain on the battlefield, and Grassy Surge is a hidden ability that allows Rillaboom to activate said terrain the moment it's sent into battle. This meant that this Grass-type Starter Pokemon with a very high Attack stat could damage opponents with a physical attack that is significantly stronger than similar moves (like Quick Attack). It was a clever strategy that perfectly complemented Rillaboom's low Speed stat. This was an extremely effective ability-move combo, which is why it had to be nerfed in Generation Nine, where Grassy Glide’s power was dropped to 55.

Dracovish

Relies On Fishious Rend

  • Type : Water
  • Category : Physical
  • Power : 85
  • Debut : Generation Eight
  • Effect : A biting move whose power is doubled if the user moves before the target.

Dracovish may seem like a strange-looking Pokemon at first, but it’s actually one of the most frequently used Fossil Pokemon in the history of the franchise’s competitive scene. This is due to its excellent signature move: Fishious Rend , a strong physical attack boasting 85 power that goes up to a whopping 170 if Dracovish moves first or if the target switches during the same turn.

If that isn't already powerful enough, Fishious Rend can get even stronger thanks to one of Dracovish’s other abilities: Strong Jaw, which doubles the power of every biting move. The combination of Fishious Rend and Strong Jaw has made Dracovish into a really fun and effective Pokemon to use in battle, but it also relies way too much on it and, as a result, it can’t really do much without it.

Houndstone

Relies On Last Respects

  • Type : Ghost
  • Category : Physical
  • Power : 50
  • Debut : Generation Nine
  • Effect : A physical attack that gets stronger the more defeated allies are in the user’s party.

Sometimes, a very good move is tragically paired up with a really mediocre Pokemon, which is exactly what happened to Last Respects , the signature move of Houndstone . While it does fit its graveyard theme perfectly—since it gets stronger the more Pokemon in the party the opponent has knocked out—it’s also the only real reason Houndstone has had any sort of presence in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet ’s competitive scene.

After all, Pokemon battles always result in the defeat of multiple party members, so if Houndstone is sent in at the last minute, Last Respects’ power can go up to 250 and take down almost any opponent that isn't resistant to it. The sad truth is, if Houndstone couldn’t learn this move, it would rarely be chosen by professional Pokemon players, which is why many of them prefer to train Basculegion instead, as it’s the only other Pokemon that can learn Last Respects.

item.title: Dying Light The Beast: Iris' Husband's Grave Location (Last Wish Safe Codes)
item.description:
Dying Light: The Beast has a ton of side quests which fleshes out the stories of other NPCs that Kyle meets along his journey. One of these side quests becomes available mid-game, which sends Kyle in search of a music box to fulfill a request from an old lady called Iris. However, things won't go as straightforwardly as the objective, as players will also need to find Iris' husband's grave and figure out the safe codes in the Last Wish side quest.

How to Start the Last Wish Side Quest in Dying Light: The Beast

Players can start the the Last Wish after completing the "Some Like It Dark" quest and unlocking the Exiles Cave save zone in Dying Light: The Beast . Once you've completed the quest, you'll be acquainted to different exiles who have similar powers to Kyle Crane, albeit different in nature.

Inside the cave, head to the lower portion, and you'll meet up with Amelia, who'll be looking over a sick lady called Iris . Since there's an "exclamation mark" symbol on her head, you can proceed to talk to Amelia to start the Last Wish side quest. This would require Kyle to first reach Iris' house, place flowers on her husband's grave, and then retrieve a music box for her.

Iris Husband's Grave Location in Last Wish Quest

Once you accept the Last Wish quest, head to the location until you spot a house surrounded by zombies. To make finding Iris' husband's grave easier, simply use the exterior of the house to climb to the roof .

Once you're atop the roof, look towards the trees with golden leaves to the right.

Head to the area marked in the image above to finally stumble upon Iris' husband's grave and place the flower on it to complete the first objective of the Last Wish quest in Dying Light: The Beast .

Retrieving the Music Box for Iris in Dying Light: The Beast (All Last Wish Safe Codes)

The next objective in the Last Wish side quest you'll need to complete is to find the music box and retrieve it for Iris in Dying Light: The Beast . To do that, you'll need to head back over to Iris' home and climb over from the east side to see a boarded-up window . Break the wooden planks with a weapon and enter Iris' house.

The door to Iris' room is right in front of you, but it's locked, and you'll need to find a key. Thankfully, players can find the key for the room by simply heading down the stairs and looking over the table to the right.

Inside the room, you'll find a couple of things to collect, and a locked safe placed up on the bookshelf . The safe is locked with the code nowhere in sight. After checking in with Amelia, she'll direct Kyle to check into Iris' husband's store in the Old Town.

So, now you'll need to follow the quest marker and reach Iris' husband's store inside Old Town. Enter the store using the little crawlspace underneath the main door. Make sure to eliminate all the zombies inside before using the lockpick to unlock the door behind the cash register .

The door leads to the store's back office, where players can interact with the journal on the desk to find out the code for the locked safe in Iris' house. However, after returning to the house, the safe will be stole, and now you'll need to find where it went.

After tracking the thief's footprints, players will come across a warehouse and will be able to see armed enemies inside via Kyle's beast sense. You can enter the warehouse through an open window right atop conveniently placed boxes.

Inside, there will be some thugs that you'll need to defeat before coming across three different locked safes. Here are all the safe codes and combinations that you'll need to unlock the safe in Dying Light: The Beast Last Wish side quest.

Locked Safe

Location

Safe Code

Reward

Iris' Locked Safe

Safe to the left in front of the tool wall on a wooden table.

20-07-06

Iris' Music Box (Quest Item)

Last Wish Locked Safe 1

Same place as Iris' locked safe, but on the right.

11-17-08

Jewelry (Rare Valuable)

Last Wish Locked Safe 2

Other corner of the warehouse, in front of the car.

71-61-45

Once you've retrieved the music box for Iris, return to the Exiles Cave safe zone and hand over the item to Amelia. This will mark the Last Wish quest in Dying Light: The Beast as complete and players will be rewarded two Service Manuals and a lot of XP for leveling up.

8.2 /10
8 /10

Dying Light: The Beast

item.title: Best Games Where You Explore A Truly Bizarre World
item.description:
Some games want to keep players grounded in boring realism. But others chuck them into places that make no sense whatsoever, and they're better off for it. These are the games that wholeheartedly embrace that which is weird, unsettling, and wonderfully alien, offering players an experience unlike any other.

Whether these games involve strange claymation RPGs, whole worlds devoured by endless rolling cylinders, or surreal corporate nightmares, each of these titles pushes exploration right into a realm of pure discovery. Every turn is unpredictable. These strange lands will leave a lasting impression, sticking with players long after they've put down the controller.

Hylics

A Claymation Trip Through The Surreal

Hylics
RPG
Systems
Released
October 2, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Mason Lindroth
Powered by

Hylics is a turn-based RPG where nothing looks or behaves as anyone would expect. The characters are sculpted out of clay, and the backgrounds seem almost painted by hand. Even the dialogue feels like it's been generated with a broken thesaurus. The result is a game that feels like players are exploring someone’s actual dreamscape.

Combat is equally strange. Psychedelic animations are everywhere, and the game's enemies resemble half-finished sculptures. Progression feels deliberately obtuse, encouraging players to experiment and embrace the nonsense until, somehow, it all begins to make a lick of sense. Few games commit this hard to the absurd, which makes Hylics a one-of-a-kind journey through a world that’s as confusing as it is fascinating.

Outer Wilds

A Clockwork Solar System

Outer Wilds
9.2 /10
Released
May 28, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Fantasy Violence, Alcohol Reference
Developer(s)
Mobius Digital
Powered by

Few games capture that feeling of discovery quite like Outer Wilds . Its brilliant clockwork solar system, which resets every twenty-two minutes, forces players to use knowledge, rather than brute power, to progress. Every planet feels like a little puzzle box waiting to be cracked open.

Brittle Hollow collapses into a black hole. Dark Bramble folds space like intricate origami, and the Hourglass Twins bury and unbury secrets beneath shifting sands. There are no markers or tutorials here, just pure, unadulterated curiosity as a compass. The result is a world that feels alive, strange, and endlessly rewarding for those who keep exploring.

Cruelty Squad

Capitalism Has Never Been This Grotesque

Cruelty Squad
Simulation
FPS
Systems
Released
January 4, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Consumer Softproducts
Powered by

Cruelty Squad flings players into a corporate dystopia that’s equal parts biting satire and full-on nightmare. The world is deliberately ugly, and packed with absurd biotech that lets players do everything from grappling with intestines to installing cybernetic fish organs.

Levels feel like proper fever dream dioramas, with color palettes that practically burn into the retinas and architecture that barely makes any sense. But the absurdity works in its favor, reinforcing the themes of dehumanization and unchecked capitalism. It's a game that feels both hostile and hypnotic at the same time, daring players to keep going deeper into its disgusting, yet compelling, world.

NaissancE

A World Of Concrete And Silence

NaissanceE strips away story and dialogue, leaving players all alone in an endless maze of concrete megastructures. The world is dark, lonely, and towering in its sheer scale, with architecture that feels like it was designed for actual giants, rather than mere humans.

The game thrives on its atmosphere, letting silence do most of the heavy lifting for the storytelling. Light and shadow become vital guides, and progress feels like trespassing through some ancient, forgotten ruin that still vaguely remembers it once served a purpose. NaissanceE is a love letter to the unsettling beauty of brutalism, where every hallway feels like a brand-new secret.

The Eternal Cylinder

The World Doesn't Like You

The Eternal Cylinder drops players onto a planet that is constantly being flattened by a massive, omnipotent rolling cylinder. It's equal parts hilarious and terrifying, forcing players to stay on the move as they evolve some species of odd little creatures.

Every single corner of this alien world is home to bizarre lifeforms, from floating predators to gargantuan biomechanical guardians. And the constant presence of that cylinder gives the game a sense of tension that never quite goes away. It’s a survival story set in a world that's trying to crush the player, both literally and figuratively.

Journey to the Savage Planet

Corporate Chaos On A Candy-Colored Planet

Journey to the Savage Planet
9 /10
Released
January 28, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood and Gore, Crude Humor, Language, Use of Drugs, Violence
Developer(s)
Typhoon Studios
Powered by

Journey to the Savage Planet invites players to explore a vibrant, yet hostile, planet in the name of interstellar capitalism. The world is colorful and cartoonishly alien, chock-full of bouncy plants, aggressive wildlife, and incessant corporate messages reminding players how expendable they are.

Exploration is driven by upgrading tools and cataloguing alien lifeforms, turning the entire planet into one big, delightful playground of discovery. Its unique mix of humor, platforming, and clever environmental storytelling creates a world that feels equal parts dangerous and ridiculous. It’s a bizarre place, but one that rewards every detour.

Rain World

The Harshest Jungle Gym

Rain World
7.8 /10
Released
March 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Tobacco Reference
Developer(s)
Videocult
Powered by

In Rain World , players control a small slugcat, trying to survive in a vast, decaying ecosystem. And the world? It's brutal, pure and simple. Predators lurk everywhere, and the weather can kill in mere seconds. Every encounter feels tense and unpredictable.

Exploration becomes an intense exercise in learning the behaviors of creatures and using the environment to survive. It’s a world that doesn't care whether players succeed or not, which makes every moment of progress feel truly earned. Rain World’s world is strange, unforgiving, and hauntingly beautiful in its quietest moments.

item.title: Roblox: Hell's Garden Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Hell's Garden is a farm simulator based on one of the most popular Roblox games, Grow A Garden , but this inspired mode has a creepy style with survival elements. Here, you will not only have to grow a garden, but also fight for your life against monsters and dangers that will pursue you, which requires a lot of Tix and Revives.

To make the gameplay and development process much easier, you can redeem the Hell's Garden codes that we have collected for you below. The rewards are a bunch of Spins, Revives, and other useful items for your comfort.

All Hell's Garden Codes

Working Hell's Garden Codes

  • 600likes! - Redeem this code to get five Spins and Revive.
  • 900likes! - Redeem this code to get five Spins and Revive.
  • 500likes! - Redeem this code to get five Spins and Revive.
  • 15kfavs - Redeem this code to get seven Spins and Revive.
  • Ezspins - Redeem this code to get five Spins.
  • CheesyGames - Redeem this code to get five Spins and two Revives.
  • Release - Redeem this code to get three Spins and Revive.
  • Freetix - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.

Expired Hell's Garden Codes

There are currently no expired Hell's Garden codes, so redeem active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

Hell's Garden also differs from the original in that your garden lives as long as you do. Hell's Garden codes will give you exactly what you need, namely Revives, which will help you live longer, so take advantage of them.

How to Redeem Codes for Hell's Garden

The most difficult part of getting rewards from Hell's Garden codes is probably figuring out how to redeem them. The problem is that there is no button in the interface to open the redemption menu, but we have explained exactly how you can enter your free codes and redeem them:

  • Launch Hell's Garden .
  • Once in the lobby, look around. Near the spawn point, you should see a birdhouse with the inscription “Codes” above it. Approach it and interact with it.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a green Redeem button below it. Now enter one of the active codes from the list above into the input field.
  • Finally, click on the green Redeem button to submit your request for rewards.

If everything is done correctly, a notification will appear on the screen with a list of rewards received.

How to Get More Hell's Garden Codes

If the rewards you have received are not enough and you want to find more codes for this Roblox game, the best option would be to visit the game's official social media pages. This is where the developers share promo codes and publish them first, so be careful not to miss anything:

  • Official Hell's Garden Roblox group.
  • Official Hell's Garden game page.
  • Official Hell's Garden Discord server.
  • Official Hell's Garden YouTube channel.
Roblox
443
8.8 /10
Released
September 1, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

item.title: Ghost of Yotei: Best Charms
item.description:
Ghost of Yotei features so many different Charms, both Minor and Major. Every Charm has a unique effect that can make your build for Atsu extremely powerful, and as such, it's essential to know which ones you should be looking out for. Below, we've outlined the best Charms in Ghost of Yotei , what they do, and how you can get them. The Charms below are categorized into the 7 stats: Onryo, Melee, Ranged, Defense, Utility, and Stealth . Players can find 3 of the best Charms in each category, so check out what ones you're missing out on!

Looking for some truly powerful builds to make use of these Charms? Take a look at our overpowered Ghost of Yotei builds!

Best Onryo Charms in Ghost of Yotei

Onryo Charms provide Atsu with buffs to her special killer abilities, and are genuinely used best for her Onryo abilities that involve killing and terrifying enemies, as well as reviving herself. These Charms help make getting hit less punishing so you can keep using Onryo abilities:

Charm of Eager Revenge

  • Description: Reduces the kill streak requirement of Ghost Stance by 1.
  • How to Get: Purchased from Taro the Scavenger for 1,000 Coins (Must reach Chapter 3)

Charm of Onryo's Protection

  • Description: Taking damage reduces kill streak count by 1 instead of resetting it. It cannot be reduced past 1. Kill streaks power Onryo's Howl and other deadly techniques.
  • How to Get: Purchased from Taro the Scavenger for 1,000 Coins

Charm of Masakado

  • Description: Onryo's Will revives you at full health.
  • How to Get: Climb to the top of the Amber Respite Shrine in Tokachi Range, west of Ubari Lake and Ohara Plains.

Best Melee Charms in Ghost of Yotei

Melee Charms will help Atsu through more generous Parry windows, and also provide Atsu with additional Health and other bonuses for close-range combat with her melee weapons. These are extremely important Charms for how they aid in the skill of Perfect Parries and the rewards that come with it:

Charm of Futsunushi

  • Description: Parries, Perfect Parries, and Perfect Dodges are easier to perform.
  • How to Get: Climb to the top of the Faithful Leap Shrine in Tokachi Range, found east of the Niikappu River and beyond the Twin Ponds of Hidaka.

Father's Charm

  • Description: A gift from your father, so your sword flows like a brush stroke. Perfect Parries regain a minor amount of Health.
  • How to Get: Climb to the top of the Mount Yotei Shrine in the Yotei Grasslands, with the starting point found just west of the Yotei River.

Takezo's Charm of Bold Deflection

  • Description: Parrying inflicts a major amount of additional Stagger damage.
  • How to Get: Defeat Takezo's Disciple at the Dueling Tree just west of Yubari Lake in the Tokachi Range region.

Best Ranged Charms in Ghost of Yotei

Ranged Charms help players with Quickfire weapons and Bows, essentially improving the power and usefulness of all ranged weapons. We selected these Charms for their potential to grant Concentration to slow time, and increase damage:

Charm of Kibitsuhiko

  • Description: Land headshots while using Concentration to extend its duration by a minor amount.
  • How to Get: Reach the Top of the Risen Fog Shrine, found at the very north area of Tokachi Range, past the ferry and Boar's Eye Cave toward the Great Lake.

Mother's Charm

  • Description: A gift from your mother. Her presence on the wind quickens your Arrows, increasing their damage by a minor amount.
  • How to Get: Climb to the top of the Mount Yotei Shrine in the Yotei Grasslands, with the starting point found just west of the Yotei River.

Charm of Burning Blades

  • Description: Kunai now inflict Fire damage and ignite flammable objects.
  • How to Get: Complete all 5 Hana's Farms in Teshio Ridge during "The Winters Farms" Sensei Tale, started from the Contested Farm northwest of Hakodake Mountains.

Best Defense Charms in Ghost of Yotei

Defense Charms help Atsu's survivability, providing Charms that can add to her health pool and reward her with the ability to take more hits before death. These Charms have been chosen for their potential to reduce damage taken and to regain more Health:

Charm of Mount Yotei

  • Description: Reduces all damage taken by a moderate amount. Regain a major amount of Health after a Perfect Parry.
  • How to Get: Complete Mountain Reliquary Puzzles, of which there are 5 in total.

Takezo's Charm of the Stout Heart

  • Description: Increase the potency of the Heal Technique by a major amount.
  • How to Get: Defeat Takezo's Disciple, located at the Dueling Tree to the northeast of Tokachi Range by the Niikappu Falls.

Charm of Thoughtful Restoration

  • Description: Gain a major increase to maximum Health.
  • How to Get: Bathe in any of the 16 Hot Springs found across Ezo, and upgrade it via the same method of discovery.

Best Utility Charms in Ghost of Yotei

Utility Charms are all about scavenging, and they allow Atsu to gather more resources, whether that's from looted enemies or the wild. The Charms below will help players gather more resources for upgrades, and provide more ammo for Quickfire Weapons:

Charm of Kanayago

  • Description: Increase the amount of common and rare metals and black powder collected when scavenging.
  • How to Get: Reach the top of the Fall's Rest Shrine in the Yotei Grasslands, found southeast of Lake Shikotsu.

Charm of Bountiful Harvest

  • Description: Increase the amount of wood, flowers, and plants gained when collecting them.
  • How to Get: Found at the base of an old tree in the Shikotsu Woods, near to the lake and tree stump just west of The Old Stables in the Yotei Grasslands. Only unlocks during and after the "Old Trails" Side Tale.

Charm of Generous Opponents

  • Description: Chance to recover Quickfire ammo when looting the dead.
  • How to Get: Complete the Clear Water Fox Den, located north of the Iwor Woods in the Nayoro Wilds.

Best Stealth Charms in Ghost of Yotei

With Stealth Charms, players will be able to improve Atsu's shinobi potential by providing her with buffs that further reduce enemy detection speed, and just genuinely make it harder for Atsu to get caught when in stealth. Here are the best 3 to improve Atsu's detection rate, healing factor with Smoke Bombs, and Terrify chance with Assassinations (the last two work great together):

Charm of Masaka

  • Description: Using a Smoke Bomb regains a major amount of Health.
  • How to Get: Climb to the top of the "Enduring Hold Shrine" in Teshio Ridge, located in the north west region of the Sentinel Forest.

Charm of Fearful End

  • Description: All types of Assassinations have a moderate chance to Terrify nearby enemies.
  • How to Get: Received from the Onryo Gift Altar available at the central hub of each region. Further Onryo Gifts can be awarded by completing main missions.

Charm of Lingering Shadows

  • Description: Reduce enemy detection speed by a major amount.
  • How to Get: Complete the High Wall Fox Den in the Teshio Ridge region, located in the north within the Sarufutsu River.
10
9.3 /10
10 /10

Ghost of Yotei
